alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 3:25AM EST until December 06 at 2:38PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia...Tennessee... Lookout Creek near New England affecting Hamilton and Dade Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Forsyth and Fulton Counties. For the Lookout Creek...including Flintstone, New England...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Large portions of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will be flooded. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around two feet of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around 3 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EST Tuesday was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest ti around 7 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later his morning. - Flood stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
